content: Yes, reducing your seafood consumption can help to reduce your impact on marine ecosystems. As global demand for seafood increases, overfishing, habitat destruction, and other negative impacts on marine ecosystems become more prevalent. By choosing to eat less seafood, you can help to reduce the demand for it and allow fisheries time to recover. Additionally, consuming certain types of seafood can also contribute to the accumulation of toxins and plastic in the ocean, which can harm marine life and pose health risks to humans. Reducing your seafood consumption, or opting for sustainably sourced options, can make a significant difference in preserving marine ecosystems.
